GT.content: “exhausting faculty” of “nature” given to narrator of “Counterfeit Money” as a “gift”: to look for what cannot be found where & when one is looking for it
GT.linkedContent: “exhausting faculty” of “nature” given to narrator of “Counterfeit Money” as a “gift”: to look for what cannot be found where & when one is looking for it

GT.content: to look for (chercher) the impossible is that form of madness
GT.linkedContent: to look for (chercher) the impossible is that form of madness

MONL.content: this inexhaustible solipsism is myself before me, lastingly (A demeure)
MONL.linkedContent: this inexhaustible solipsism is myself before me, lastingly (A demeure)

MONL.content: disorder of identity: does it favor or inhibit anamnesia? heighten desire for memory? both! exhausts us, point of losing our breath, our minds
MONL.linkedContent: disorder of identity: does it favor or inhibit anamnesia? heighten desire for memory? both! exhausts us, point of losing our breath, our minds

OOG.content: for Husserl, ideal of exhaustive deductivity re: evolution of [geometrical] axiomatization toward a total formalization (limits to which are found in Gödel’s theorem) must be secondary to primordial sense-fashioning
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, ideal of exhaustive deductivity re: evolution of [geometrical] axiomatization toward a total formalization (limits to which are found in Gödel’s theorem) must be secondary to primordial sense-fashioning

OOG.content: to pass from question “how” to question “why” (“why is there any historical factuality?”) we must exhaust question of historicity’s sense and historicity as sense > the “why,” the ontological question, owes its seriousness to a phenomenological certainty, arises only out of a teleological affirmation, i.e. out of freedom
OOG.linkedContent: to pass from question “how” to question “why” (“why is there any historical factuality?”) we must exhaust question of historicity’s sense and historicity as sense > the “why,” the ontological question, owes its seriousness to a phenomenological certainty, arises only out of a teleological affirmation, i.e. out of freedom

OOG.content: only phenomenology stripped Fact of its materiality [sense can always not be incarnated?]
OOG.linkedContent: only phenomenology stripped Fact of its materiality [sense can always not be incarnated?]

LOBL.content: the temptation of an exhaustive reading

HERP.content: [re: Heidegger on hearing] “before leaving this inexhaustible paragraph”
HERP.linkedContent: [re: Heidegger on hearing] “before leaving this inexhaustible paragraph”

SW.content: I am so fatigued from knowing truth, that history of the veil—that truth: too old for me, too old like me (however young I remain) > you don’t know the “fatigue” I’m talking about (dreaming of writing in Spanish, forgotten ancestral language)
SW.linkedContent: I am so fatigued from knowing truth, that history of the veil—that truth: too old for me, too old like me (however young I remain) > you don’t know the “fatigue” I’m talking about (dreaming of writing in Spanish, forgotten ancestral language)

SW.content: infinite weariness of tropes, what do you expect, I want to end it all (protest, attestation, testament, manifesto against the shroud) > no longer write around/in/under folds of truth
SW.linkedContent: infinite weariness of tropes, what do you expect, I want to end it all (protest, attestation, testament, manifesto against the shroud) > no longer write around/in/under folds of truth

SW.content: complaint (of exhaustion) & accusation lodged against matrix of discourse of veil
SW.linkedContent: complaint (of exhaustion) & accusation lodged against matrix of discourse of veil

SW.content: complain about myself to myself: immodesty, impudence > but veil makes modest
SW.linkedContent: complain about myself to myself: immodesty, impudence > but veil makes modest

SW.content: complaint: give up all modesty, most elementary politeness
SW.linkedContent: complaint: give up all modesty, most elementary politeness

SW.content: Derrida knows too well how to do the history of veils > there’s the fault: “commencer…à bien faire” (TN. “begin to do too well” or “it’s getting to be too much”); tiresome, tireless, tired out history I’m leaving behind me, running after me
SW.linkedContent: Derrida knows too well how to do the history of veils > there’s the fault: “commencer…à bien faire” (TN. “begin to do too well” or “it’s getting to be too much”); tiresome, tireless, tired out history I’m leaving behind me, running after me

SW.content: epuisement recalls the water & the well (le puits) of truth, back to the pit, the hole (puteus)
SW.linkedContent: epuisement recalls the water & the well (le puits) of truth, back to the pit, the hole (puteus)

SW.content: has Derrida left no one the right to say the veil has something to hide? that it will suffice to have done w/ veil to access Thing itself (Cause safe & intact)?
SW.linkedContent: has Derrida left no one the right to say the veil has something to hide? that it will suffice to have done w/ veil to access Thing itself (Cause safe & intact)?

PIO.content: why this new desire for “invention” (not creation, institution, etc.)? that worn-out (usé), classical word? desire for invention dreams of inventing a new desire, still contemporary w/ a certain weariness, exhaustion, but also accompanies a desire for deconstruction (lifting [lever] contradiction that might exist btwn invention/deconstruction)
PIO.linkedContent: why this new desire for “invention” (not creation, institution, etc.)? that worn-out (usé), classical word? desire for invention dreams of inventing a new desire, still contemporary w/ a certain weariness, exhaustion, but also accompanies a desire for deconstruction (lifting [lever] contradiction that might exist btwn invention/deconstruction)

RM.content: Derrida has regularly questioned (w/ insistence that might be judged tiresome) the “privilege of the name,” opposing its primacy w/ attention to syntactic motif
RM.linkedContent: Derrida has regularly questioned (w/ insistence that might be judged tiresome) the “privilege of the name,” opposing its primacy w/ attention to syntactic motif

TN.content: Nancy: writing is violent exhaustion of the discourse in which “all sense” is altered in exscribed body
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: writing is violent exhaustion of the discourse in which “all sense” is altered in exscribed body

OG.content: death of book announces death of full speech, announces exhaustion of language’s archon [speech], as if language now seen as a species of writing, as a (short) 3000 year adventure: announces new mutation in history of writing
OG.linkedContent: death of book announces death of full speech, announces exhaustion of language’s archon [speech], as if language now seen as a species of writing, as a (short) 3000 year adventure: announces new mutation in history of writing

IF.content: Flaubert like Mallarmé: inscribed in locus of philosophical exhaustion, simulacrum of dialectic, both expose its limits & impossibility > simulacrum that discredits oppositions (both mimic Platonic-Hegelian Idea while emptying it of its metaphysical/dialectic content)
IF.linkedContent: Flaubert like Mallarmé: inscribed in locus of philosophical exhaustion, simulacrum of dialectic, both expose its limits & impossibility > simulacrum that discredits oppositions (both mimic Platonic-Hegelian Idea while emptying it of its metaphysical/dialectic content)
